page.title: 05 Effect of the Motorway M5
page.content: Before the M5 was open there was a title change in the villages of East Brent and Brent Knoll. Any alterations were gradual and spread over many years. The M5 from Exeter, with links to Bristol, London and Birmingham, opened in 1973 and has access road at Edithmead very close to both villages. There is also a rest/picnic area known as Brent Knoll Rest Area, but actually in the East brent boundaries. This is a parking area with toilets and some food facilities. Since it was opened, many people have moved into both villages from the towns. More houses have been built and old houses renovated.
